Module ehubicka.scheduler
Package ehubicka.Controller

Class Login

java.lang.Object
ehubicka.Controller.Login
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class Login extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class serves as the first screen a user sees upon executing the application. Users will be prompted to login using credentials stored in a MySql database. If successful, users will be taken to the mainscreen.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Used to initialize the controller with any code that needs to be implemented when this screen is accessed. Text will be translated between French/English depending on the users local language setting. The local zone ID of the user will be detected and displayed.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - passes the resources associated with the FXML file
      resourceBundle - manages location specific resources (strings, various data-types, etc)

    • onLoginClick

      protected void onLoginClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Validates the user login credentials and allowing the user to see the mainscreen if the username and password are valid within the database. If not, alerts will be displayed. Upon successful login, a message will display saying whether an upcoming appointment within 15 minutes is happening or not. Will log all login attempts to an output file recording the outcome of the attempt along with the timestamp. Login error messages will be translated between French/English depending on the users local language setting.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - When the login button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - most likely if FXMLLoader.load() can't find the .fxml file or if the output file cannot be written to.

    • OnActionExit

      public void OnActionExit(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      When exit button pressed, exit the application main screen window and close the database connection
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the exit button is pressed
